data.title: Updates from the 2013 Timken Grand Parade as it happened
data.meta_description: A rolling blog of updates from the route of the 2013 Timken Grand Parade as compiled from our reporters on Twitter: Kelli Young @kyoungREP , Alison Matas @amatasREP , Edd Pritchard @epritchardREP andâ€¦
data.text:
A rolling blog of updates from the route of the 2013 Timken Grand Parade as compiled from our reporters on Twitter:

12:14 p.m.

kyoungREP: Cleveland Avenue is now open in both directions. #Hofparade #HOF50

12:12 p.m.

amatasREP: It was fun to talk to Ravens fans today because I was working for @baltimoresun when the Ravens won the Super Bowl #worldscollide #HOF50

11:28 a.m.

#Hofparade route north of 17th still closed while road crews use leaf blowers to push trash into the street for the street sweepers. #HOF50

11:24 a.m.

amatasREP: Things I learned today: You can't have a parade without doughnuts, and spinning balloons are a really big deal #HOF50

11:21 a.m.

sdoerschukREP #HOF50. A standing ovation, please, for Gale Sayers. At 70, he walked much of the long parade route, shaking as many hands as he could find.

11:14 a.m.

kyoungREP: Canton medics say no serious injuries were reported during today's #Hofparade. #HOF50

10:03 a.m.

Now that all the enshrines have passed, people are packing up to leave #HOF50

10:01 a.m.

Bake sale at 1244 Cleveland is a fundraiser to renovate the old Dominos into an art studio. Big seller? Pepperoni rolls. #Hofparade #HOF50

9:56 a.m.

Bob St. Clair is smoking a cigar and singing, "I love a parade." #HOF50

9:49 a.m.

Warren Sapp's family is yelling, "we love canton, Ohio!"

9:27 a.m.

Big gap between Keenan Advantage and the South Shore Drill team. Break time. #HOF50

9:26 a.m.

All running smoothly in the TV area at #HOF50 over halfway through.

9:21 a.m.

Giant potato followed by Minerva band play 'Cheeseburgers in Paradise." Great combo. #HOF50 #HOFParade

9:07 a.m.

Roger Wehrli just whipped out his phone to photograph fans #HOF50

8:56 a.m.

Crowd demands "spin it." Morse crew responds. Only the birds are angry. Cheer @ 18th street.#HOF50 #HOFparade

8:47 a.m.

Spotted County Engineer Keith Bennett in the #Hofparade, not in a fancy car but on a tractor with the Boy Scout clean up crew. #HOFparade

8:42 a.m.

Weather literally changed from rain to sun at 8 am, the moment the Hall of Fame parade stepped off. Proof that God loves football? #HOF50

8:41 .am.

Sam Huff is waving with one hand, holding the Rep in the other #HOF50

8:21 a.m.

Cheers of "You go, Larry!" as Larry Allen comes past, but there's more applause for the spinning star balloon that follows him #HOF50

8:17 a.m.

Medics at McKinley and Cleveland NW say the only medical issue they've seen so far was a blister. #Hofparade #HOF50

8:06 a.m.

Near the halfway point of the #Hofparade route, spaces along the sidewalk are beginning to fill in. Still a few empty spots.#HOF50

7:56 a.m.

The Timken Grand Parade stepped off Saturday morning under cloudy gray skies at the corner of Sixth Street and Cleveland Avenue SW.

Despite the downpour leading up to the 8 a.m. start, thousands of spectators lined the 2.2-mile route, which ends at 25th Street NW. Nearly 200,000 people were expected to attend.

This year's parade lineup features 106 units, including the seven Hall of Fame enshrinees and their families, past Hall of Famers, 11 different floats, several giant helium balloon characters and marching bands from GlenOak, Lake, North Canton, Marlington, McKinley, Timken, Tuslaw, Canton South, Massillon, Sandy Valley, Jackson, Central Catholic, Alliance and Minerva high schools.

This is the 50th year anniversary for the original enshrinement festival event.

Follow the Repository's coverage of the parade on Twitter @cantonrepdotcom or follow Repository writers Kelli Young @kyoungREP, Alison Matas @amatasREP, Edd Pritchard @epritchardREP and Denise Sautters @dsauttersREP.

Fox Sports Net Ohio will broadcast the parade from 4:30 to 6:30 p.m. Aug. 11 and from 8 to 10 p.m. Aug. 14. The parade also can be viewed at 8 p.m. Aug. 13 on Time Warner Cable Channel 989, WIVM Channel 39 and Massillon Cable.

7:54 a.m.

There's already a line to use the portable bathrooms - it's five people deep, and the parade hasn't started #HOF50

7:39 a.m.

Rain has stopped as the 2013 #HOF50 Timken Grand Parade begins to form for the 8 a.m. step off. #HOFParade cantonrep.com

7:36 a.m.

#HOF50 parade chair John Fehrenbach has been up all night. Ready to go.

7:31 a.m.

Local team MaryAnn's appears to being winning the pre-parade doughnut wars. #HOF50

7:30 a.m.

Street sweepers are pushing away puddles before the parade starts. Luckily, the rain has stopped. #HOF50

7:30 a.m.

RT @lreicoskyREP: #HOF50 Dan Dierdorf and Stefani Shaffer have arrived for parade telecast. pic.twitter.com/jIzXwEcs53

6:30 a.m.
